hypothesis_content.title: Neutral Regime Support Bounce in Meme Coins (DOGE/PEPE)
hypothesis_content.statement: In a sustained NEUTRAL regime (>10 days), when a high-sentiment meme coin (DOGE or PEPE) pulls back to its key volume-weighted average price (VWAP) from the regime start date, a daily RSI(4) reading < 30 provides a high-probability mean reversion long entry for a +15-25% bounce.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes define a trading range. Meme coins, driven by retail sentiment, often overshoot within that range. The regime-start VWAP acts as a 'fair price' anchor. An oversold condition (RSI(4)<30) at this support, without excessive leverage (neutral funding), sets up for a sharp reversion toward the range mean.
entry_conditions: Regime == NEUTRAL for at least last 10 days
Asset (DOGE/USD or PEPE/USD) price ≤ VWAP (calculated from regime start date)
24h funding rates are neutral or negative (≤ 0.01%)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price reaches +20% from entry OR returns to the 20-day SMA
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price closes >8% below the VWAP support level

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The bounce fails to materialize (median 5-day return after signal < +5%) or the VWAP level shows no significant support properties.
